perturbation.original_text: Insolvency Event. Either Party may terminate this Agreement effective immediately upon delivery of a Termination Notice if the other Party is (A) dissolved or is seeking to dissolve itself under applicable corporate law other than as part of a corporate restructuring under which its assets were first transferred to an assignee under this Agreement in accordance with Section 10.2; or (B) (i) becomes subject to an Insolvency Event, provided that, no termination right shall exist in respect of an Insolvency Event that is a chapter 11 case under the Bankruptcy Code if the Party subject to such chapter 11 case (x) continues to perform all of its material obligations under this Agreement, (y) does not seek to reject this Agreement or take any action in such chapter 11 case to disavow or undermine the rights of the other Party under this Agreement, and (z) assumes this Agreement on or before any deadline in such chapter 11 case for such assumption; notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing herein shall limit or prevent the Party not subject to an Insolvency Event from objecting to assumption or assumption and assignment of this Agreement or requiring cure payments or adequate assurance
perturbation.changed_text: Insolvency Event. Either Party may terminate this Agreement effective immediately upon delivery of a Termination Notice if the other Party is (A) dissolved or is seeking to dissolve itself under applicable corporate law other than as part of a corporate restructuring under which its assets were first transferred to an assignee under this Agreement in accordance with Section 10.2; or (B) (i) becomes subject to an Insolvency Event, provided that, no termination right shall exist in respect of an Insolvency Event that is a chapter 11 case under the Bankruptcy Code if the Party subject to such chapter 11 case (x) continues to perform none of its material obligations under this Agreement, (y) does seek to reject this Agreement or take any action in such chapter 11 case to disavow or undermine the rights of the other Party under this Agreement, and (z) assumes this Agreement after any deadline in such chapter 11 case for such assumption; notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing herein shall limit or prevent the Party not subject to an Insolvency Event from objecting to assumption or assumption and assignment of this Agreement or requiring cure payments or adequate assurance
perturbation.explanation: The clause initially provided some protections to a party undergoing a Chapter 11 bankruptcy, ensuring the agreement remains in force if the party continues to perform its obligations and assumes the agreement within a certain timeframe. This modification removes these protections, allowing immediate termination even if the bankrupt party is trying to fulfill its duties and assume the agreement in a timely manner. This violates the principles and protections afforded under US Bankruptcy Code, which aims to provide a debtor with an opportunity to reorganize and continue operating.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 11 U.S. Code ยง 365 - Executory contracts and unexpired leases

perturbation.original_text: If any Party believes the other is in material breach of any of its material obligations under this Agreement in a manner other than as set forth in Article III to which this Section 8.2(b) does not apply, it may give notice of such material breach to the allegedly breaching Party, which Party shall have [**] (or such longer period of time as may be reasonably commensurate with the effort reasonably required to remedy such default) in which to remedy such default. If such alleged material breach is not remedied in the time period set forth above, the Party alleging material breach shall refer the matter to the chief executive officers of each Party, who shall meet and confer within [**] after notice from the non-breaching Party of its desire for such a meeting. If the Parties are unable to resolve any dispute in such meeting and no Action has been brought in accordance with Section 10.8 with respect to such dispute, the non-breaching Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon delivery to the defaulting Party of a Termination Notice. The non-defaulting Party's right to terminate this Agreement in accordance with this Section 8.2(b) shall not be construed as an exclusive remedy.
perturbation.changed_text: If any Party believes the other is in material breach of any of its material obligations under this Agreement in a manner other than as set forth in Article III to which this Section 8.2(b) does not apply, it may give notice of such material breach to the allegedly breaching Party, which Party shall have 1 day to remedy such default. If such alleged material breach is not remedied in the time period set forth above, the Party alleging material breach can immediately terminate this Agreement upon delivery to the defaulting Party of a Termination Notice. The non-defaulting Party's right to terminate this Agreement in accordance with this Section 8.2(b) shall be construed as an exclusive remedy.
perturbation.explanation: By reducing the cure period to '1 day', the modified clause creates an unreasonably short timeframe for the breaching party to remedy a material breach. Additionally, specifying that the termination is the exclusive remedy restricts the non-breaching party's options, which may violate general principles of contract law that seek to provide fair and reasonable remedies for breach of contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding reasonable cure periods and availability of remedies.

perturbation.original_text: 8.3 Surviving Rights/Obligations. (a) The provisions of Articles V, VI, VII and IX and Sections 8.3, 8.4, 10.1, 10.2, 10.5 - 10.13 and 10.15, together with any provisions required for the interpretation or enforcement of any of the foregoing, shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement, provided, however that Section 7.3(a)(iv) shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for only [**] thereafter. The termination of this Agreement shall not relieve any Party from obligations that are expressly indicated to survive termination of the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.3 Surviving Rights/Obligations. (a) Only the provisions of Article V shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement, The termination of this Agreement shall relieve any Party from all obligations, including those expressly indicated to survive termination of the Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By drastically limiting the clauses that survive termination and stating that termination relieves all obligations, this change introduces several contradictions. It attempts to nullify standard contract practices that ensure certain obligations (like confidentiality or intellectual property protections) remain in effect after the agreement ends, potentially violating established legal norms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding surviving obligations and enforceability of clauses post-termination.
